> 
> Still not a single experimentals update on SteamDB... What is going on here? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

I wouldn't be to surprised if they switched Experimentals to an internal setup, and they only update SteamDB ocasionally to keep the hype alive.

> 
> Then again, given how they've been rushing through things lately (single-release beta, relatively short "1.0" development period)....release confirmed for today!

You really think they're rushing things? At 113 days now, this has been the longest period so far. Heres a reference of the time between recent versions: version .18 - 73 days since previous update, .19 - 105, .20 - 66, .21 - 64, .22 - 84, .23 - 62, .23.5 - 105, .24 - 107, .25 - 82, .90 - 69 days. They said this experimental, which they announced less than a week ago, would be longer than most others, so I'm guessing about four weeks total. 

Seeing as how the only major addition SQUAD is handling is the new aero system, (the other stuff are either small additions or being handled by outside mod makers) I don't think they're rushing at all.

the rush he is refering to is going to 1.0 after only 1 beta cycle. the game was alpha for 3 or 4 years, and after 4 months of 1 beta update its jumping to 1.0?

Quite a few think its way too quick to jump that far: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/108318-Do-you-feel-KSP-is-ready-for-1-0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/108318-Do-you-feel-KSP-is-ready-for-1-0)

at the least I think this should be .99, and 1.0 can be the final bug fix/tweak update. All these features they are adding to this update might need to be rebalanced anyway. QA and experimentals are not perfect anyway.

"About an hour ago Linux scratchpad was updated."

"About an hour ago OS X scratchpad was updated."

"About 2 hours ago PC scratchpad was updated."

Should be last updates of the day.

Since they'll probably release a 1.00.1 soon after launch with patches for bugs that slipped through, 1.0 could be .99 and 1.00.1 could be 1.0. It just seems so anticlimactic for the big release to have nothing new about it. It would just be going from nearly bug free to completely\* bug free.

\*probably

Wooooo!

New cursors!

Hype!

Bigger physics bubble!

Lots of hype!

If I didn't have to work, I'd be standing here, bobbing up and down expectantly, waiting for the release.

Since I have to work though, I am on here, reading the forums and avoiding work.

Can't wait for 1.0!
I think the name of this thread should be changed to: The official 1.0 hypetrain.
I have the .50 Funds, can the train make a routine 30-second stop for new passengers to dive on before it's too late? \*ready to dive\*
\*lands\* Alright, looks like my RC VTOL brought me to the right place. Hopping on!

First PC Experimental is up! Looks like it's out of scratchpad!

--updated--

Linux and Mac Experimentals up as well.
